com.turbomanage.httpclient
Class AbstractHttpClient

java.lang.Object
  com.turbomanage.httpclient.AbstractHttpClient
Direct Known Subclasses:
AsyncHttpClient, BasicHttpClient
public abstract class AbstractHttpClient
extends java.lang.Object

Lightweight HTTP client that facilitates GET, POST, PUT, and DELETE requests using HttpURLConnection. Extend this class to support specialized content and response types (see BasicHttpClient for an example). To enable streaming, buffering, or other types of readers / writers, set an alternate RequestHandler.

Author:
David M. Chandler

execute

public HttpResponse execute(HttpRequest httpRequest)
This method wraps the call to doHttpMethod and invokes the custom error handler in case of exception. It may be overridden by other clients such AsyncHttpClient in order to wrap the exception handling for purposes of retries, etc.

Parameters:
httpRequest -
Returns:
Response object (may be null if request did not complete)

addHeader

public AbstractHttpClient addHeader(java.lang.String name,
                                    java.lang.String value)
Adds to the headers that will be sent with each request from this client instance. The request headers added with this method are applied by calling URLConnection.setRequestProperty(String, String) after prepareConnection(HttpURLConnection, HttpMethod, String), so they may supplement or replace headers which have already been set. Calls to addHeader(String, String) may be chained. To clear all headers added with this method, call clearHeaders().

Parameters:
name -
value -
Returns:
this client for method chaining

clearHeaders

public void clearHeaders()
Clears all request headers that have been added using addHeader(String, String). This method has no effect on headers which result from request properties set by this class or its associated RequestHandler when preparing the HttpURLConnection.

getCookieManager

public static java.net.CookieManager getCookieManager()
Returns the CookieManager associated with this client.

Returns:
CookieManager

Sets the logger to be used for each request.

setConnectionTimeout

public void setConnectionTimeout(int connectionTimeout)
Sets the connection timeout in ms. This is the amount of time that HttpURLConnection will wait to successfully connect to the remote server. The read timeout begins once connection has been established.

Parameters:
connectionTimeout -

setReadTimeout

public void setReadTimeout(int readTimeout)
Sets the read timeout in ms, which begins after connection has been made. For large amounts of data expected, bump this up to make sure you allow adequate time to receive it.

Parameters:
readTimeout -
